files.name: Base data pack
files.description:
Required data pack.
For Gaia Sky 3.2.0-RC16 and above. Contains the solar system planets and moons, minor planets, satellites, orbits, constellations, the Milky Way, grids, locations and other important objects. Without this data pack Gaia Sky won't start.
files.releasenotes:
- WARN: The milky way and the constellations in this pack will only work with 3.2.0-RC16+.
- Fix typo in the 'Mikly' Way title.
- Add Oort cloud and solar neighborhood titles.
- Adjust location settings for Earth, Moon and Gaia.

files.name: High resolution textures
files.description: High resolution texture pack including some 4K and 8K textures and cubemaps for planet surfaces and asteroids
files.releasenotes:
- Add high-resolution Earth day and cloud cubemaps.
- Remove Earth day and cloud equirectangular textures.

files.name: Gaia DR3 default
files.description: Star catalog based on Gaia DR3, with a good balance between good distances and number of stars. Contains all stars with up to 20%/1.5% bright/faint parallax relative error.
files.releasenotes:
- Contains a selection of DR3 and all Hipparcos stars.
- The cross-match table used is in the archive.
- Distances are derived from parallaxes (d=1000/plx).
- Parallaxes are using the corrected terms.
- Extinction and reddening corrections are applied to magnitudes and colors.

files.name: Gaia DR3 small
files.description: Star catalog based on Gaia DR3 with a small number of stars. Contains all stars with up to 10%/0.5% bright/faint parallax relative error.
files.releasenotes:
- Contains a selection of DR3 and all Hipparcos stars.
- The cross-match table used is in the archive.
- Distances are derived from parallaxes (d=1000/plx).
- Parallaxes are using the corrected terms.
- Extinction and reddening corrections are applied to magnitudes and colors.

files.name: Gaia DR3 medium
files.description: Star catalog based on Gaia DR3 with a moderate number of stars. Contains all stars with up to 30%/5% bright/faint parallax relative error.
files.releasenotes:
- Contains a selection of DR3 and all Hipparcos stars.
- The cross-match table used is in the archive.
- Distances are derived from parallaxes (d=1000/plx).
- Parallaxes are using the corrected terms.
- Extinction and reddening corrections are applied to magnitudes and colors.

files.name: Gaia DR3 large
files.description: Star catalog based on Gaia DR3 with a large number of stars. Contains all stars with up to 50%/12.5% bright/faint parallax relative error.
files.releasenotes:
- Contains a selection of DR3 and all Hipparcos stars.
- The cross-match table used is in the archive.
- Distances are derived from parallaxes (d=1000/plx).
- Parallaxes are using the corrected terms.
- Extinction and reddening corrections are applied to magnitudes and colors.

files.name: Gaia DR3 very large
files.description: Star catalog based on Gaia DR3 with a very large number of stars. Contains all stars with up to 50% parallax relative error.
files.releasenotes:
- Contains a selection of DR3 and all Hipparcos stars.
- The cross-match table used is in the archive.
- Distances are derived from parallaxes (d=1000/plx).
- Parallaxes are using the corrected terms.
- Extinction and reddening corrections are applied to magnitudes and colors.

files.name: Gaia DR3 extra large
files.description: Star catalog based on Gaia DR3 with an extremely large number of stars. Contains all stars with up to 95% parallax relative error.
files.releasenotes:
- Contains a selection of DR3 and all Hipparcos stars.
- The cross-match table used is in the archive.
- Distances are derived from parallaxes (d=1000/plx).
- Parallaxes are using the corrected terms.
- Extinction and reddening corrections are applied to magnitudes and colors.

files.name: Gaia DR3 bright
files.description: Star catalog based on Gaia DR3 with the brightest stars in the catalog. Contains all stars with up to 90%/1% bright/faint parallax relative error.
files.releasenotes:
- Contains a selection of DR3 and all Hipparcos stars.
- The cross-match table used is in the archive.
- Distances are derived from parallaxes (d=1000/plx).
- Parallaxes are using the corrected terms.
- Extinction and reddening corrections are applied to magnitudes and colors.

files.name: Gaia DR3 RUWE
files.description: Star catalog based on Gaia DR3. Contains the stars for which the RUWE (re-normalized unit weight error) is <= 1.4.
files.releasenotes:
- Contains a selection of DR3 and all Hipparcos stars.
- The cross-match table used is in the archive.
- Distances are derived from parallaxes (d=1000/plx).
- Parallaxes are using the corrected terms.
- Extinction and reddening corrections are applied to magnitudes and colors.

files.name: Gaia DR3 bayesian distances
files.description: Star catalog based on Gaia DR3. Contains all stars with bayesian distances as determined by Bailer-Jones et. al.
files.releasenotes:
- Contains all DR3 and all Hipparcos stars with 3D positions.
- The cross-match table used is in the archive.
- Distances are from Bayler-Jones et.al.
- Extinction and reddening corrections are applied to magnitudes and colors.

files.name: Gaia DR3 fidelity
files.description: Star catalog based on Gaia DR3. Contains all stars for which the fidelity value is > 0.5.
files.releasenotes:
- Contains a selection of DR3 and all Hipparcos stars.
- The cross-match table used is in the archive.
- Distances are derived from parallaxes (d=1000/plx).
- Extinction and reddening corrections are applied to magnitudes and colors.

files.name: Gaia DR3 photometric distances
files.description: Star catalog based on Gaia DR3. Contains all stars with photometric distances from GSP-Phot Aeneas best library using BP/RP spectra.
files.releasenotes:
- Contains a selection of DR3 and all Hipparcos stars.
- The cross-match table used is in the archive.
- Distances are from the distance_gspphot column in the archive.
- Extinction and reddening corrections are applied to magnitudes and colors.

files.name: catalog-gcns
files.description: Gaia Catalog of Nearby Stars - GCNS, Gaia Catalog of Nearby Stars (R.L. Smart et. al., 2020)
files.releasenotes: Add type to catalog descriptor file

files.name: catalog-whitedwarfs-dr2
files.description: DR2 white dwarfs - White dwarfs catalog based on GDR2 by Gentile Fusillo et al. 2018, MNRAS 482, 4579 - Brightnesses increased by 10 mag
files.releasenotes: Reorganise folder structure

files.name: catalog-whitedwarfs-edr3
files.description: eDR3 white dwarfs - White dwarfs catalog based on Gaia eDR3 data, by Gentile Fusillo et al. 2021, MNRAS. Contains 359073 high-confidence white dwarf candidates (Pwd>0.75).
files.releasenotes: First version

files.name: DR2 Cepheid and RR Lyrae
files.description: Chepeid and RR Lyrae stars in Gaia DR2, brightened up by 5 magnitudes.
files.releasenotes:
- Second version of Gaia DR2 variable stars catalog.
- Contains only Cepheid and RR Lyrae stars.
- Contains 106k variable stars with their light curves.
- Only stars with periods are included.
- Stars are 5 magnitudes brighter for visibility.
- Edit particles-dr2-variable-stars.json to change mag factor.
- Light curves with more than 20 data points are resampled to fit into shader attributes.

files.name: Gaia DR3 Cepheid and RR Lyrae
files.description: Cepheid and RR Lyrae stars in Gaia DR3, brightened up by 5 magnitudes.
files.releasenotes:
- Initial version of Gaia DR3 variable stars catalog.
- Contains Cepheid and RR Lyrae stars only.
- Contains 186k variable stars with their light curves.
- Only stars with periods are included.
- Stars are 5 magnitudes brighter for visibility.
- Edit particles-dr3-variables-tars.json to change mag factor.
- Light curves with more than 20 data points are resampled to fit into shader attributes.

files.name: catalog-gd1
files.description: GD1 stream - GD-1 star stream with brighter magnitudes for visibility
files.releasenotes: Publish first version of GD-1

files.name: catalog-hipparcos-newred
files.description: Hipparcos - Hipparcos new reduction (van Leeuwen, 2007) with curated star names, already included in all DR2 catalogs
files.releasenotes: Add type in catalog descriptor file

files.name: catalog-nbg
files.description: NBG catalog - Nearby Galaxies Catalog, contains M87 black hole
files.releasenotes: Update LMC and SMC names for the new Wiki connection feature

files.name: NBG catalog
files.description: Nearby Galaxies Catalog, containing more than 800 close-by galaxies. It also contains the M87 black hole
files.releasenotes:
- Move NBG to JSON format.
- Add catalog info so that NBG appears in the datasets pane.

files.description: Open Clusters DR2 - Open Clusters catalog based on DR2 data, by A. Castro-Ginard et al. - 2017 clusters

files.description: Open Clusters catalog based on DR2 data, by A. Castro-Ginard et al.
files.releasenotes: - Move loading out of generic catalog to JSON driven process.

files.name: catalog-mwsc
files.description: MWSC - Milky Way Star Clusters catalog

files.name: MWSC
files.description: Milky Way Star Clusters catalog
files.releasenotes: - Move loading out of generic catalog to JSON driven process.

files.name: catalog-nebulae
files.description: Nebulae - Catalog of 15 nebulae with textures

files.name: catalog-nebulae
files.description: Nebulae - Catalog of 15 nebulae with textures
files.releasenotes: Add type to catalog descriptor file

files.name: Asteroids and SSO (Gaia DR2)
files.description: Some 14k asteroids and other SSO, based on Gaia DR2 data.
files.releasenotes: - Separate DR2 asteroids from base data pack.

files.name: Asteroids and SSO (Gaia DR3)
files.description: About 154k asteroids and other SSO, based on Gaia DR3 data.
files.releasenotes: - All DR3 asteroids contained in two files.\n- Contains 150k asteroids.\n- Contains 125 orbits.

files.name: gargantua-blackhole
files.description: Gargantua Black Hole - The black hole from Interstellar, somewhere in the galaxy...
files.releasenotes: Shader code cleanup, should work with intel UHD

files.name: Exonia system
files.description: A made-up partially procedurally generated extra-solar system with two stars, four planets and a moon.
files.releasenotes: - First version with two procedurally-generated planets and a manually textured one

files.name: Gl876 system
files.description: A system with a star and a planet. The Gaia orbit corresponds to the M-dwarf's reflex motion due to the orbiting planet, which is a gas giant. It was one of the earliest radial-velocity discovery. The system is less than 5 pc from the Sun.
files.releasenotes: - First version of this system.

files.name: HD40503 system
files.description: A small system with a star and a planet. It is a candidate giant exoplanet around a K dwarf discovered by Gaia astrometry. The orbital period is about 850 days and the inferred planet mass is around 5 Jupiter masses.
files.releasenotes: - First version of this system.

files.name: HD81040 system
files.description: A system with a super-Jupiter orbiting a G-type star with a period of 1000 days. The planet was discovered using Gaia radial velocities, and Gaia determined the star's astrometric orbit.
files.releasenotes: - First version of this system.

files.name: HD114762 system
files.description: This star hosts the first substellar companion candidate around a solar-type star which was identified from radial velocities in 1989. The Gaia results show that the orbit is seen almost face-on and the companion is, therefore, a low-mass M dwarf.
files.releasenotes: - First version of this system.

files.name: J0805+4812 system
files.description: This known system is composed of two brown dwarfs orbiting each other with spectral types L4 and T5. Gaia's orbit determination refers to the photocentre of the system, dominated by the brighter primary component.
files.releasenotes: - First version of this system.

files.name: UCAC2 1151977 system
files.description: UCAC2 1151977 is a Sirius-like binary comprising a main sequence primary with a white dwarf companion. The white dwarf is considerably hotter than the primary star.
files.releasenotes: - First version of this system.

files.name: WD0141-675 system
files.description: A candidate giant exoplanet around a nearby white dwarf discovered by Gaia astrometry. The orbital period is about 33 days and the inferred planet mass is about 9 Jupiter masses. The white dwarf is located within 10 pc from the Sun.
files.releasenotes: - First version of this system.

files.name: Oort cloud
files.description: Oort cloud data. This simulated dataset contains 10000 particles.
files.releasenotes: This first version moves the Oort cloud out of the base data package.

files.name: mesh-dr2-dust
files.description: Dust maps based on GDR2 data - Isosurfaces for 15% and 60% density
files.releasenotes: Add type to catalog descriptor file

files.name: mesh-dr2-hii
files.description: HII regions based on GDR2 data - Isosurfaces for HII regions
files.releasenotes: Add type to catalog descriptor file

files.name: mesh-dr2-isodensity
files.description: Hot star isodensities based on GDR2 - Isodensity surfaces of hot stars for different preset values

files.name: Dust iso-surface mesh (DR3)
files.description: 30% dust density iso-surface based on DR3 data, produced by Kevin Jardine. Dust from 'Three-dimensional extinction maps: Inverting inter-calibrated extinction catalogues' by J.R. Vergely, R. Lallement and N.L.J. Cox, 2022. Dust extinction cubes provided by Rosine Lallement.
files.releasenotes: - Initial version of this dataset.

files.name: HII regions (DR3)
files.description: HII regions (clouds of partially ionized gas) based on DR3 data, produced by Kevin Jardine. The HII region positions were determined by known ionizing stars and clusters with sizes estimated using Douglas Finkbeiner's H-alpha Full Sky Map and distances taken from 'Estimating Distances from Parallaxes. V. Geometric and Photogeometric Distances to 1.47 Billion Stars in Gaia Early Data Release 3' by C.A.L. Bailer-Jones et.al. 2021.
files.releasenotes: - Initial version of this dataset.

files.name: Star density iso-surface mesh (DR3)
files.description: 35% star density iso-surfaces based on DR3 data, produced by Kevin Jardine. sosurface algorithm inspired by 'Cosmography of OB stars in the solar neighbourhood.' Astronomy & Astrophysics 584 (2015): A26 by H. Bouy and J. Alves. Hot star density and bar orientation from 'Gaia Data Release 3: Mapping the asymmetric disc of the Milky Way' by the Gaia Collaboration, R. Drimmel, et al. 2022. Data provided by Ronald Drimmel.
files.releasenotes: - Initial version of this dataset.

files.name: James Webb Space Telescope
files.description: The James Webb Space Telescope, with its orbit around L2 and a wavefront (.obj) 3D model.
files.releasenotes: - Update metallic materials of JWST.
